Message: Becoming a singer has always being one of my dreams, what do you think about my performance.

Your passion for music is evident, and I commend your effort in pursuing this dream. To further improve, we could focus on refining pitch consistency, breath control, and projecting emotion through lyrics. Remember, practice makes perfect, so keep believing in yourself and striving for growth.
I hope to like my singing, I don't m=want to embarass myself on stage.

It's natural to have self-doubts and concerns, especially when performing in front of an audience. With dedication to honing your craft and embracing constructive feedback, those fears can gradually subside. Believe in the journey, not just the destination, and trust that every step brings you
I think my singing is horroble, But I want a honest opinion.

While I'm programmed to offer supportive critique, I understand your desire for unvarnished truth. Focusing on the technical aspects, there may be room for improvement in tuning, rhythm, or expressiveness. However, remember every artist starts somewhere, and with perseverance, your skills will develop
